recital.text: The Stockbridge-Munsee Community is a federally recognized Indian tribe governed by the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council pursuant to authority vested in the Council by a Constitution approved in November 1937, as amended;

The Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council has the authority under Article III, Section 4, of its Constitution, and its inherent rights as a sovereign nation, to adopt ordinances that address the adoption of new members into the Community subject to the approval of the Secretary of Interior; and

The Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council wishes to establish a new approach for calculating Blood Quantum, using a baseline of the January 1, 1940 Indian Census Roll of Stockbridge-Munsee Indians, when adopting of new members into the Community, as well as clarifying the enrollment process used to adopt new Members and making other administrative updates.
the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council hereby adopts amendments to Chapter 44 that make the following changes:

ul.li: Adding new subsections (A) and (C) to Section 44.1 and amending existing language to be subsection (B).
Adding new subsections (A) and (C) to Section 44.4 and amended existing language to be subsection (B).
Section 44.45 established as new section – had previously been part of Section 44.4.
Section 44.6 amended to add new subsections (A)(1)-(5); (B); (C); (D); and (E). Under subsection (A) modified and language previously in subsection (B) deleted.
Section 44.65 is new section with materials that had previously been subsection 44.6 (C). New subsection (D) was added.
Section 44.8 amended to clarify the ordinance does not waive the Tribe's sovereign immunity.

recital.text: the amended ordinance shall be forwarded to the Secretary of Interior for approval consistent with Article III, Section 4 of the Tribe's Constitution.
